The Orient Express pulls up in Paris: An opulent journey into the 1920s
Subhead: The legendary luxury train is making a stop at Paris's Musée des Arts Décoratifs until spring. As part of the major exhibition dedicated to the centenary of Art Deco, three life-size mock-ups of the new Orient Express, set to return to service soon, are on display.

Title: The Italian city of Lucca is drawing thousands of cosplayers
Subhead: The Lucca Comics & Games Festival, dedicated to comics and gaming, runs until November 2 and hosts one of the world's largest pop culture gatherings. This year's edition pays tribute to France.

A dizzying dive into Bob Wilson's Long Island theater of objects
Subhead: Famous for his groundbreaking shows, the American stage director, who died this summer at the age of 83, was also a great lover of art and design. A compulsive collector of chairs, which he created for his productions, he left behind thousands of works gathered throughout his life, spread between his Manhattan loft-studio, storage warehouses and the Water Mill art center, which he founded on Long Island.

Title: 'Airbnb has shaped the idea that everything can be monetized. It's a logic of constant optimization'
Subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (2/6). In Paris, about one-third of the listings available on Airbnb have been removed from the 'permanent' housing market, which contributes to the housing crisis in the French capital, explains researcher Jeanne Richon in an interview with Le Monde.

Title: Water rises and land sinks in Vietnam's Mekong Delta
Subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (5/6) The Mekong Delta and Ho Chi Minh City, home to a third of Vietnam's population, face rising seas and the toll of decades of resource overuse, leaving much of the delta at risk of submersion.
